instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Have this A1502 here which is missing its display and I sadly have no test displays. So I attempted to power it up and the fan spins but it doesn?t chime or output a signal to an external display. Anyone got a clue what could be going wrong?

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message:
Is that 820-3476 board?
Any history available?
Did you try PRAM reset?

CPU VCORE is present?
Also check PLT_RESET_L.

Try known good working BIOS.
Check first all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and traces.

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Oof completely forget the board number. Me idiot! It?s the 820-3536A board. I have no history on this one. When I pulled the board out I did notice a prior repair though which always sucks. They ran a jumper from L1295 to C1297 as well as replaced C7371. I did try the normal resets without success. VCORE is 2.1V measured on C1031. PLT_RESET_L is 0V. Don?t have a way to flash a new bios to the board atm. What sort of programmer would I need?

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message:
No BIOS activity prior PLT_RESET_L, so don't touch it yet.

"VCORE is 2.1V measured on C1031"
Are you really sure?
Too high, check it with different voltmeter.
Also check CPU_VR_READY level.

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Used my old meter (not my nice PeakTech Unit) and got 1.728V. CPU_VR_READY is 1.8V. Hope that helps

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message:
Change the battery of the other multimeter.
And do not spend lot of money on precision meters; not a real help!

Check for corrosion at U1950; post its voltages.

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message:
Yup the battery did the trick! Now the values match my old meter. Voltages at U1950 are:

Pin 1 - 3.3V
Pin 2 - 1.7V
Pin 3 - 0V
Pin 4 - GND
Pin 5 - 0V
Pin 6 - 0V
Pin 8 - 3.4V

hope those help

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message:
You've missed pin 7.
However not important, as pin 2 is not correctly defined.

Check R1950; if good, change U1950.

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Yeah didn?t include that on purpose as it?s a duplicate pin. What do you mean by good?

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: If has correct ohm value...

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Back to this old thread after over a month. Got a replacement U1950 in, made no difference. Also tested the original one on a known booting board and it worked. Any other ideas on what I can try?

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: You must get 3V at pin 2/U1950...

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Only get about 1.7V...

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message:
Check R1950; does it have 3V on pin 1?
If yes, change U1950...

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Quick question: Is U2100/U7950 on the 820-3332 compatible?

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: All of them 74LVC2G08GT, so yes.

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Okay so I changed it and R1950 but still stuck at 1.7V on R1950…

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Do you have 3V at pin 1/R1950?

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Yup I do. Pin 2 is 1.7 and Pin 1 3.3

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message:
Change again U1950.
Did you solder 10K into R1950 place?

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Yup. Tried two more and no change.

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message:
Any corrosion there?
Input voltage cannot drop so much.
Be sure the chip is correctly soldered.
You can try to force the signal, soldering 1K instead of 10K resistor.

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Well the board has seen liquid damage but the are looks fine. I’ll check the chip again and if not try the 1k resistor

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: So with the 1k resistor it has about 3.3V on both sides of the resistor. Still doesn’t work though… No display or anything.

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Also still wondering why someone who worked on the board before me ran a jumper between Pin 1 of C1297 and Pin 2 of L1295… Someone seems to have already given up on this one or it failed later

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message:
Post all voltages for U1950.

Do you get voltage at L1295 (pad 2)?

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: It’s 1.070V. Also now know why the jumper, pad 2 was torn off the board

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message:
And for U1950 we get:

Pin 1 - 3.3
Pin 2 - 3.3
Pin 3 - 3.4
Pin 4 - 0 (GND)
Pin 5 - 3.4
Pin 6 - 3.4
Pin 7 - 3.4
Pin 8 - 3.4

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Also super strange is the fact that pin 2 on R1950 occasionally shows 1.8V despite using the 1k resistor. If I unplug and replug power it fixes it

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message:
If you get 3V at pin 3, is good.
Check if PLT_RESET_L comes high.

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Well isn’t that Pin 3?

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Also I’ve noticed pin 2 of R1950 seems to be at 3.3v for about 14s (estimate) before falling to 1.8. Same at Pin 1 so PP3V3_S0 is falling

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message:
So 3V3_S0 drops after 15s?
Which voltages remain present then?

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Yes. You mean Voltages on U1950?

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: In general, which voltages disappear from MLB?

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: What should I check? There are tons of voltages...

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Usually the big coils, not too many...

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message:
Okay:

L7130- 12.79
L7520- 5.18
L7320- 1.71
L7310- 1.70
L7630- 1.06
L7430- 1.36
L7710- 0V
L3095- 0V

hope those help. What a frustrating board as it’s so close to working with the cpu heating up, fan spin etc…

BTW I also noticed R6131 wasn’t on the board near the SPI flash. Is that always not populated?

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: If 3V3_S0 drops to 1.8V, you should note more incorrect voltages.

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: What should I do now?

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Did you measure these voltages when 3V3_S0 drops?

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Yes I let the board sit for 30s or so

threads.title: A1502 2013 13? MacBook Pro Fan Spin, no chine or Display output
threads.message: Are you sure 3V3_S0 was 1.8V then???
